fragment: Walter White, a high-school chemistry teacher, turns to a life of crime and partners with a former student to produce and distribute methamphetamine.
Skyler White, Walter's wife, becomes increasingly suspicious of her husband's behavior after he starts behaving in unfamiliar ways.
Jesse Pinkman, Walter's former student and cooking partner, is a funny kid who gets mixed up in the wrong crowd.
Hank Schrader, Walter's brother-in-law and a DEA agent, investigates the presence of a drug lord known as Heisenberg.
Marie Schrader, Skyler's sister and Hank's wife, is a kleptomaniac who is there for her family but is also unpleasant.
Walter White Jr., Walter and Skyler's son, has cerebral palsy and starts lashing out after his father's cancer diagnosis.
Gustavo Fring, a high-level drug distributor and owner of Los Pollos Hermanos, has a cover as a fast-food chain owner.
Saul Goodman, a crooked lawyer, represents Walter and Jesse and draws inspiration from film producer Robert Evans.
Mike Ehrmantraut, a private investigator and hitman, works for Gus as an all-purpose cleaner and also for Saul.
Lydia Rodarte-Quayle, a high-ranking employee of Madrigal Electromotive, reluctantly supplies Walter and Jesse with methylamine.
Todd Alquist, an employee of Vamonos Pest Control, becomes an associate of Walter and Jesse.
Huell Babineaux, Saul's bodyguard, also handles problems that Walter needs fixing.
